intro: Mallotus paniculatus, commonly known as the white sander, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces distinctive, spiny fruits that contain seeds covered in a fleshy, orange aril. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in disturbed soils and open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
